newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Newcrest says high-grade Cadia result.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Newcrest says high-grade Cadia result.

text.p: Newcrest Mining Ltd said on Monday it had intersected high grade gold and copper mineralisation three kilometres west of its Cadia Hill mine.
Core drilling at the Ridgeway prospect in hole NC498 had intersected a zone of Cadia-style quartz veining, it said.
Assays for a 71-metre section downhole from 665 metres recorded 7.2 grams per tonne of gold and 1.6 percent copper.
Newcrest said the hole may have intersected the mineralised zone at an oblique angle, exaggerating its thickness.
Managing director John Quinn said Newcrest would accelerate its drilling program to determine how close the mineralisation was to surface and its lateral extent and depth.
Newcrest recieved government approval in September for the Cadia Hill mine near Orange in central New South Wales.
